page.title: 18FARM STUDY DUNTISBOURNE LEER
page.content: The farm is small for the area , 100 acres,and has been worked by the farmer alone since 1948.Most of the buildings ,including the pigsty (now used for ducks),are listed.The farm- house ,dating from 1517,has pigeon holes,a reminder of a cheap source of meat for the Lord long ago.In 1985 the farmer is concentrating on wheat, barley and peas ,hoping this will bring greatest profit.Peas replaced sheep this year for profit reasons and because sheep took up more of the farmer's time.Next year might be different.Hay is grown to feed his horses and to sell locally as an animal feed.It is only grown on land too steep or too poor to grow more profitable crops.A small experimental plot of Christmas trees is being tried and elsewhere trees have been planted to hide farm buildings.
